H0.text: Which sport was developed in 1895 when the Rugby Union refused to allow professionalism. American Football

H1.text: Which sport was developed in 1895 when the Rugby Union refused to allow professionalism. Australian Rules Football

H2.text: Which sport was developed in 1895 when the Rugby Union refused to allow professionalism. Gaelic Football

H3.text: Which sport was developed in 1895 when the Rugby Union refused to allow professionalism. Rugby 13

A4.text: It originated in 1895 in Huddersfield, West Yorkshire, England, as the result of a split from the Rugby Football Union (RFU) over the issue of payments to players.

A5.text: In 1895, a decree by the RFU banning the playing of rugby at grounds where entrance fees were charged led to twenty-two clubs (including Stockport, who negotiated by telephone) meeting at the George Hotel, Huddersfield, on 29 August 1895 and forming the 'Northern Rugby Football Union'.
